Minneapolis Community Fridge Network

FREE FOOD — Take What You Need, Leave What You Can

Our network of community fridges operates 24/7 across Minneapolis. No questions asked, no ID required.

## Fridge Locations

**Powderhorn Fridge**
3400 Bloomington Ave S (outside Arbeiter Brewing)
Stocked daily by volunteers from Powderhorn Community Garden

**Cedar-Riverside Fridge**
1925 S 4th Street (next to Hard Times Cafe)
Primary stock: halal options, East African staples, fresh produce

**North Minneapolis Fridge**
1007 W Broadway Ave (outside Breaking Bread Cafe)
Focus: culturally appropriate foods for the Northside community

**Longfellow Fridge**
3700 Minnehaha Ave (near Sea Salt Eatery parking lot)
New! Opened January 2026. Seeking regular stockers.

## How to Help

- **Stock a fridge:** Bring prepared food, fresh produce, or sealed packaged goods to any location
- **Become a regular stocker:** Email fridges@mplsmutualaid.org
- **Report a maintenance issue:** Text (612) 555-0188
- **Donate supplies (coolers, cleaning supplies):** Drop off at Powderhorn location

## Guidelines
- No expired food
- Label homemade items with ingredients and date
- Keep the area clean — take trash with you

Operated by Minneapolis Mutual Aid Network in partnership with neighborhood associations.
